availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Martin Van Buren Griffey (Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Griffey and Elizabeth Griffey. Student in Hickman County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1850. Farmer in Hickman County in 1860. Household owned five enslaved persons in Hickman County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, pp. 23A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, p. 668.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Moscow, p. 452.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Moscow, p. 204A.
Find A Grave, "Martin Van Buren Griffey (1837-1909)," Memorial #144541284, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/144541284 (accessed September 9, 2020).
